Reviews.Title: “Bumps in the night”
Reviews.Author: Foodtripper101
Reviews.Content: Our 3rd italian city this spring. We found it to be the least hotel among our other hotel and appartment choices. Hotel room was small, bathroom was tiny with 2 toilet bowls facing each other separated by less than an inch of space and the shower sliding door was incomplete. beds were comfortable however. In the middle of the night we were awakened at 2-5 am by what sounded like heavy furniture being dragged around the room above us. It was good we only had to stay the night. The breakfast however was ok with breads, hams and cereal. Wifi was advertised as free but was only meant for 2 hours. The staff could understand english but were not as friendly as the other establishments.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely AWFUL service - will never go back!”
Reviews.Author: Dee198407
Reviews.Content: On arrival my sister needed to use the toilet and the receptionist refused to let her until we checked in and she handed us the room key, even though there was a reception toilet! She rudely asked for our passports and once she was done making copies she left them them on the counter (opposite to were I was standing) and disappeared into a back room without saying a word. After 5 minutes of waiting, I realised she was done but hadn't bothered to let me know! The next morning I called reception to ask why the water wasn't getting hot after running it for 10minutes, a guy said to me he doesn't speak English, when I asked if someone else could help me he said no. We never got a smile from any of the staff and chose to ignore them and make the most of our stay. The hotel itself is quite modern and the rooms are nice and breakfast is good.

Reviews.Title: “Location only.”
Reviews.Author: Labroy
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, a 2 minute walk from Venezia Mestre train station. From here it's a 1â‚¬ and 10 minute train ride into the main part of Venice. Our room was ok, nothing special. The walls are very thin and we had to put up with a short, but rather loud session in the next room! Breakfast was ok considering it's included in the room rate, wouldn't pay for it though. Even though it has some faults and could do with a re-vamp, the location and price make it an attractive option.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mgr89
Reviews.Content: the hotel was really nice - right opposity the train station in Mestre. You can take a train to Venice every 20 minutes and costs only 1 euro. The train takes about 10 minutes and you are in the centre of Venice - so good location. Also, the hotel was very clean and everyday clean towels, bedding etc. Our room was very big with a big double bed and a nice balkony. The breakfast in the morning was also very good, nice coffee, capucino, bread, yoghurt, juice de orange, croissant etc. Also the staff was very friendly and tried to help us as good as possible altough there English was not that good. I can really recommend this hotel to everyone who would like to visit Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Best Two Star we have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: ASchaal
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel. The staff were shockingly friendly. Room was very accommodating. Would give this hotel 10 out of 10 stars. And would never stay anywhere else in Verona.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for early morning train”
Reviews.Author: telldavid
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night with my wife and two boys aged 11. I purposely chose the location next to Mestre train station because we were catching an early morning train to Ljubljiana. The room was very small for all four of us but spotless and could of been a problem regarding space if we were staying longer. However we did not spend any time in the room as we spent the evening in Venice which is only minutes away on the train from Mestre station. The hotel wasn't cheap compared to a four star that we stayed at, for longer on our return to Venice a few days later. The breakfast was not that great but the hotel served it's purpose for one nights stay. If I had to catch an early morning train again from Mestre, I would stay here for One night.

Reviews.Title: “Only for short stay”
Reviews.Author: CristianBordei
Reviews.Content: I stay at Trieste hotel in Mestre for two nights in August 2007 and I bought it again for my relatives at the start of November 2008 and I paid the same price, 82 Euro/double. The main facility of the hotel is his location, only 100 metres from the railway station, where also is the bus stop for going to Venice (the duration of the trip is around 15 minutes). The room are good enough, but the breakfast is very poor and the staff rude. This is a good hotel only for one or two nights for those who wan't to stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: mezemeze
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to stay at a hotel across from the Mestre train station but I was returning from a ski trip and traveling with skis and gear and only had a day to spend in Venice before flying home. I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel is nice, basic and a good value. The lobby is modern but upstairs there are beautiful ornate glass chandeliers and wood details. Yes the rooms are small but quite clean. The front desk staff was very helpful, friendly and spoke English. I booked on line direct no problem and called to arrive a day early, no problem. And the restaurant across the street they recommended was very good, great friendly service and half the prices you pay in Venice ( Ristorante l' Ostricaro they give you a free drink if you are staying at the hotel. ) Easy to catch the train into Venice (6 trains an hour, 1euro) and 20 min to Marco Polo Airport.

Reviews.Title: “very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Kikifamily
Reviews.Content: good hotel as long as you can speak Italian. Very clean, brand new, good breakfast, staff is helpfull within their capability. however, do not try to receive faxes : we got 13 pages charged at 10 euros... But a very good value for money, really convenient at 100m far from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Well...,so and so...”
Reviews.Author: KVRHelsinki
Reviews.Content: We arrived midnight at Venice Mestare from Florence with Eurostar. Didn't have a pre reservation so after coming out of the station we looked left and right and went to this hotel. AS we were with a 4 year old son so we didn't want to waste time in looking for different accmodations. The hotel is located less than 2 mintes walk from the railway station to the left. Here is what to expect from this hotel. We stayed at the ground floor. The room was of a reasonable size and everything was spotless clean. The furniture was very good, polished and of a very - very good quality. The AC was working fine. The beds were very comfortable. Our hats off for the house-keeper as we didn't see a single particle of dust and stab on the walls and floor of the toilets and shower. Their breakfast was really poor and is not worth of mentioning. Pricewise it is not cheap and is towards the upper side of the reasonable category. Now here is the point; the old gentleman at the reception was just a feelingless soul. They give you such a feeling that one thinks that why one came to this hotel at the first place. We asked him to extend the check out time for one hour and his reply was '' Sorry!! No extension not even for the five minutes-want to have a room or not''. In the morning the breakfast staff was in a such a big rush that they closed everything and took the dishes and the other stuff 5 minutes before the actual closing time. Two australian girls happened to arrive for breakfast 2 minutes before the closing time. The rude answer was-''we are closed now'' Even to met the request of those girls for only a cup of tea was a big thing for the staff. At the time of checkout i requested a city map of Venice and the receptionist has a two long breaths because it was too much of a work for her to go inside the office room to fetch a map. I thanked her for the stay and she didn't even bother to say -BYE! Nothing wrong with the rooms, We had a very good sleep indeed. Nothing very much right with the staff that we got to know. I personally will try something different next time but won't mind if as a last choice i need to stay here again. We get off at Venice mestare because the conductor in the train has told us that santa monica is madly expensive. My tip for the fellow travelers is that accmodation in terms of price at Venice Santa monica is no less or more than the venice mestare.

Reviews.Title: “Miserable”
Reviews.Author: b/house
Reviews.Content: Disasterous - Rude front desk. This hotel was booked through a travel agent for convenience because we had arrived from Naples by plane and caught train to Mestre before catching a train to Venice the next day for a Mediterranean Cruise. Rude Rude front desk gentleman. Couldn't find the key hole to room due to no lights on in hallway. Hot Hot room 28 degrees inside and couldn't open the window due to the noise and dirt flying in from the street opposite station. Concierge would not turn down airconditioning. told us to open window! 3 other couples were complaining when we went down to explain about air/con. He couldn't care less. We went around the corner and booked a room in the Hotel Bologna which was just wonderful and great helpful staff. We then went back and got our luggage and left within the hour as did the other 3 couples. You also had to climb over the bidet to sit on the toilet. This was supposed to be a superior room. Never stay there again. Travelled for 6 weeks around Europe and Ireland May-June 07 and this was the worst hotel ever.Should only be rate 1 *

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as suggested we thought.”
Reviews.Author: Kirkbear
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 Nights. Â£25 a night single room each. The hotel is about 5 min walk from both the Eurobus bus stop (which will bring you from Treviso airport 45 mins away) and the Mestre Railway station. Mestre station takes you over to the island in about 10 mins. It was quite nice taking the train over the sea to reach Venice Island. The first 2 staff members we met were a bit sour faced to be honest. But we had no problems getting what we wanted; they don't speak much English either. The younger staff member was very helpful and friendly. The rooms were basic but very clean. TV only has CNN for English speakers. Breakfast is cereal, tea, coffee, orange, cheeses, ham and breads. Good enough for the price. It is bigger than it looks from the pictures on here and I would recommend it for those (like me) on a budget. It's very handy for the Airport and Venice Island. They even gave us breakfast earlier than usual because we had an early flight. I asked for the third floor in my booking request, but this wasn't done. I got a blunt "FULL!" when I asked about this. 3rd floor is supposed to be nicer and newer than the others. The shower in my room was tiny and was all-in with the toilet. I used my friends as it had a proper cubicle. No problem with noise from outside or inside. If you stay here when you come out of the hotel turn right and keep going until you reach a corner bar/cafe'. They do great Italian food, have the chicken pesto. The restaurant the Hotel recommended was busy and full of very old women in minks and beehives.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: rocsmart
Reviews.Content: We spent last weekend at Trieste Hotel and we were very satisfied with our selection . The location is excellent, the room was extremely clean and nice, and the staff very helpful. We would definately go back to the Trieste Hotel again, though we didn't stay on the 3rd floor, which I understood is the best.

Reviews.Title: “One time only!”
Reviews.Author: Pendragon
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel were not that helpful, and in some cases, came across as very rude "Buongiorno" was even a little too much for some of them! The room was comparable to university halls, being quite small and very basic, though it was fairly cheap for the destination, the bathroom was almost unusable, being that the toilet was squashed into the corner and the shower was basically a shower head with a grid, see the picture! The location was good, being right opposite the train station and you could get into the heart of Venice for 1 Euro, and you could get tickets from the tobacconists next door for no extra charge! But beware; earplugs are a definite requirement, for anyone but the heaviest of sleepers as you can hear most of what is going on outside at all hours and sometimes in the adjacent rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, host and rooms!”
Reviews.Author: chrissycav
Reviews.Content: We origonally only booked the first night before our journey as we were not sure what standard the hotels would be - We ended up staying the full 3 nights!. Mr Ferrari was probably the only venetian who we felt wasn't trying to rip us off as tourists!. Our room was immaculate and cleaned every day with fresh towels. We were left to use the hotel as we wished and felt relaxed to come and go daily. The hotel is opposite the train station and therefore could not have been handier for Venice. In summary for value, cleanliness and staff we could not have chosen better.

Reviews.Title: “Launguage & Cultural Barrier”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Trieste for 3 nights arriving on the Sunday room was ok, basic but clean, the bathroom was very small with a shower although I am not sure about the toilet your knees were literally two inches from the wall!!! On the first night we realised the walls where paper thin as we could hear full conversation from the next room belching included!! It was a great location only 2 minutes from the train station although the noise of the traffic was slightly irritating but only 2 euros return to Venice On the whole the Hotel is fine if you are going on a budget, although I found the staff were extremely rude and didnt speak more than five words to us in the whole time we were there. ( theydidnt even say goodbye when we checked out) Beware when eating out in Mestre the locals do not understand much English and at times I did feel we were intruding.

Reviews.Title: “Room 106 (or should that be Room 101?)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel clean and adequate for our purpose i.e. somewhere to sleep. The bathroom was, as indicated in previous postings, very unusual in that the best way to take a shower was to sit on the loo whilst using the hand-held shower. However, the water was immediately hot and the wash-basin was large enough to take a bath in. I feel sure we must have shared the same room at the same time as the first postee because we were serenaded by a snorer in the next room. He/she had a completely uninterrupted night's sleep judging by his/her rhythmic snoring at whatever time we were woken during the night. The staff were as helpful as their limited English would allow, apart from the female receptionist (she of the smartly dressed upper half (white shirt, black jacket) and tatty jeans) who tried so desperately not to smile. On the whole the Hotel Trieste is clean and adequate and no more or less than one could ask for for what we paid. One word of warning though, if you end up in Room 106 - DON'T LOCK THE WARDROBE DOOR!!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: SuttonTravelNut
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews here of this hotel, I was also dreading staying at the Trieste! However, I was very pleasantly surprised. Admittedly I was allocated a room on the third floor without even asking, but I thought the hotel was very nice - a nice mixture of old and new. I did have problems with the bathroom though, which extended beneath the eaves and was more than a little shocked when I realised that the head space above the bath/shower was no more than about 3'6" (a bit of a problem when you stand 6'2"!). I then discovered that they provided you with a plastic stool which you could put in the bath to sit on when showering, which worked out just fine. The location was very good though, being literally across the road from the station, where for 1 Euro you can take the train straight into Venice's Santa Lucia station in 8 minutes, with trains running every few minutes. Admittedly I visited in late November, so was able to keep my window closed at all times, meaning that I could block out the sound of the trains and fairly busy road between the hotel and the station. In conclusion - go in the colder months, ask for a third floor room and be prepared to shower whilst sitting on a stool...you'll be fine! At the price, it's a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Mmmmm....not the best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had read the comments before arriving at the hotel and tried to get a room on the third floor, as none available ended up on the first floor. The room itself on first inspection seemed OK, the bathroom was as described in previous postings but we thought useable (we did not expect much more for Â£40/night) and the room was clean. However after staying for 4 nights was exhausted and looking forward to going home for a good nights sleep! Main problems were mini bar fridge did not work (was empty), air conditioning did not work and although the location of the hotel was excellent for seeing Venice (situated opposite Railway station) it was very very noisy, both with road and rail traffic. On a positive note there were a few decent budget restaurants in the area of the Hotel (half the price of Venice). All in all I would say fine if you don't mind the heat and noise and just want a base for seeing Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad!”
Reviews.Author: Herb
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel ok not as awful as reviews 1 & 2 but certainly not 5 star as review 4 did they stay at the right hotel or are they related to the owner ;) It was ok our room was fairly small and so was the bathroom we stayed on the 1st floor wish we'd known about the 3rd floor. Staff were ok as was the breakfast. The location was good and the trains did run well and often. All in all ok for the money we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was truely awful. The room and bathroom were tiny and the walls paper thin. The only word to describe the bathroom was ridiculous! It was extremely small with a sink, toilet that when you sat on it your head nearly touched the wall in front of you and a shower the like I have never seen before basically it was a wall mounted cheap shower stuck in the corner next to the toilet and the shower drain was actaully placed in front of the toilet so if you did want to have a shower you drowned everywhere with water!! The walls were so thin that we could hear the occupants in the next room snoring and I was woken up at 6.00am one morning by a TV that was so loud it may as well have been in our room. The breakfast was adequate. The staff couldnt speak very good english and didnt really want to try either. Fortuantely we only stayed there for 2 nights and frankly that was definately enough. Yes it is a budget hotel but we have stayed in budget hotels before and got a much better deal and service. Give this hotel a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Awful....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Awful is the only word to describe this hotel. It has supposedly been recently refurbished but Im not sure where!!! The room and the bathroom were very small hardly any room to move around in either of them. The bathroom was ridicoulus it had a sink, toilet and stuck right in the corner was a shower with the shower drain in front of the toilet!! so even if you did want a shower there was no room you were squashed between the toilet and the wall we tried it and water sprayed everywhere I would say it was unusable. The bedroom walls were so thin I was woken at 6.00am in the morning by the person next door snoring!!! and when they eventually stopped snoring they put the TV on which again was so loud you'd think it was in your own room. The breakfast was adequate. The staff ok but didnt speak very good English and didnt really want to try either. The only slight good thing was it was located directly near the Railway station so there wasnt much chance of getting lost but apart from that there really was nothing else about this hotel and I would definately not recommend it. However, we found Venice lovely and will definatley visit again but of course to a different hotel.
